examples.translation: frankish berry, referring to red currant
a Frankish-ware, a product made in Western Europe

etymology: From Ottoman Turkish فرنك (frenk, “Western European”), from Classical Persian فرنگ (farang, “of the Western Europe”), from Old French franc (“of the Frankish realm”), from Latin francus (“piercer like a javelin or dagger”). Noun sense 3 originates from a shortening of frenk elması (“tomato”, literally “western apple”) or frenk patlıcanı (“tomato”, literally “western eggplant”), compare Northern Kurdish firingî (“tomato”).
